etymology.description: Pictogram: pictographic representation of a field divided into four sections.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a top-down view of a plot divided by paths or furrows, which naturally came to denote farmland. The square-with-cross motif also lent itself in some ancient contexts to a mask-like image, influencing related graphs.

examples.chinese: 这片田很肥沃(這片田很肥沃)。
他们在田里劳动(他們在田裡勞動)。
examples.english: They are working in the fields.

examples.chinese: 春天农民在田里插秧(春天農民在田裡插秧)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān nóngmín zài tián lǐ chāyāng.
examples.english: In spring, farmers transplant rice seedlings in the fields.
